meanings.definition: To press something firmly between two surfaces.
meanings.sent1: She squeezed the sponge to remove the water.
meanings.sent2: He squeezed the toothpaste tube to get the last bit out.
meanings.sent3: The clown squeezed the horn, and it made a funny sound.
meanings.sent4: Her heart squeezed with joy when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The stress of the situation squeezed her chest like a vice.

meanings.definition: To extract or obtain something by applying pressure.
meanings.sent1: He squeezed the lemon to get fresh juice.
meanings.sent2: She squeezed the trigger and fired the gun.
meanings.sent3: The chef squeezed the garlic to add flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent4: His words squeezed the truth out of the witness.
meanings.sent5: The detective squeezed information from the suspect during interrogation.

meanings.definition: To fit a large number of people or things into a small space.
meanings.sent1: They squeezed into the tiny elevator to reach the top floor.
meanings.sent2: She squeezed all her clothes into the small suitcase.
meanings.sent3: The students squeezed around the small table for group work.
meanings.sent4: The cars squeezed into the parking lot for the event.
meanings.sent5: The books were squeezed tightly onto the shelf, almost touching the ceiling.
